snippet: Tucker, a black lab mix, is said to be the world’s only working dog able to track the scent of orca feces, which give clues to the whales’ health, in open ocean water.
abstract: Tucker, a black lab mix from Seattle, is said to be the world’s only working dog able to track the scent of orca feces, which give clues to the whales’ health, in open ocean water; orca scat is crucial in monitoring the health of the 85 or so killer whales that frequent the San Juan islands off the northwest Washington coast.
lead_paragraph: Tucker, a black lab mix, is said to be the world’s only working dog able to track the scent of orca feces, which give clues to the whales’ health, in open ocean water.

headline.seo: Sniffing Out a Subtle Scent, to Help Save Some Whales
headline.main: Tracking a Subtle Scent, a Dog May Help Save the Whales
headline.print_headline: Tracking a Subtle Scent, a Dog May Help Save the Whales
